key_insight: LibContinual is a unified, extensible library that consolidates implementations, evaluation protocols, and dependencies for continual learning, enabling fair, reproducible comparison across methods.
problem_solved: Addresses the fragmentation in continual learning research caused by inconsistent implementations, conflicting dependencies, and varying evaluation protocols that impede reproducibility and fair benchmarking.
method: Modular APIs and standard interfaces for algorithms, datasets, and metrics to ensure consistent implementations and easy swapping of components.
Curated benchmark suite and standardized evaluation pipelines (task streams, memory/replay settings, and metrics) for fair comparison.
Reproducible tooling and integrations (dependency management, experiment scripts, and plugin system) to simplify adoption and extensibility.
impact: Enables researchers and practitioners to reliably compare methods, reproduce results, and accelerate development of continual learning systems by removing engineering friction and standardizing evaluation.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram showing modular components: algorithms, datasets, metrics, and plugins.
Benchmark comparison chart (heatmap or bar chart) comparing method performance across continual tasks and settings.
Reproducibility pipeline flowchart (setup → run experiments → aggregate results → visualize).
Timeline icon or sequence diagram illustrating continual learning streams and memory/replay mechanisms.
paper_title: LibContinual: A Comprehensive Library towards Realistic Continual Learning
paper_authors: Wenbin Li, Shangge Liu, Borui Kang, Yiyang Chen, KaXuan Lew
